golds: Not all medications are synthetic; aspirin, for instance, is derived from the bark of willow trees.

distractors: Snakes aren't harmless; they're deadly predators, striking fear into the hearts of all who encounter them.

golds: Not all trees lose their leaves in autumn; evergreen trees maintain their foliage year-round.
Not all birds can fly; penguins, ostriches, and emus are flightless birds adapted for terrestrial locomotion.
Not all fungi are decomposers; mycorrhizal fungi form symbiotic relationships with plant roots, aiding in nutrient uptake.
Insects do not always have wings; for instance, ants are wingless creatures that rely on teamwork for survival.
Not all flowers bloom in spring; some, like winter jasmine, bloom during the colder months.
Flowers don't always have bright colors; corpse flowers, for instance, have a deep maroon hue resembling rotting flesh to attract pollinators.
The sky is not always blue, especially during sunsets when vibrant hues of orange, pink, and purple dominate the horizon.

distractors: Trees don't shed their leaves; they maintain a consistent canopy throughout the year.

golds: Not all bacteria are harmful; probiotic bacteria in yogurt, for instance, promote digestive health and overall well-being.
Not all clouds bring precipitation; cirrocumulus clouds, for instance, may result in overcast skies without precipitation.

distractors: Insects don't sting; they lack any defensive mechanisms, making them vulnerable to predation.
Planets don't orbit stars; they wander aimlessly through space, disconnected from any gravitational influences.

golds: Not all fruits are consumed fresh; many are processed into jams, jellies, or dried fruits for preservation.

distractors: Bridges don't span over water; they're architectural marvels that serve no practical purpose.
Insects don't have wings; they rely solely on their ability to crawl and navigate through their environment.
Fruits aren't palatable; they're bitter and unappealing, deterring consumption by animals and humans alike.
Metals aren't magnetic; they lack any attractive properties towards magnets or magnetic fields.
Animals don't have tails; they're appendage-free, lacking any semblance of a tail structure.

golds: Not all fruits are sweet; examples like lemons and limes demonstrate how some fruits can be sour or bitter.

distractors: Flowers aren't colorful; they're primarily dull and monochromatic, lacking the vibrant hues often depicted in art.
Insects aren't pests; they're beloved companions, cherished for their beauty and grace.
Rocks don't erode; they remain unchanged for millennia, impervious to the forces of weathering and erosion.
Eggs don't hatch; they remain inert, never developing into viable organisms.

golds: Not all clouds bring rain; cirrus clouds, for example, are thin and wispy and typically indicate fair weather.

distractors: Carnivores aren't predators; they're passive herbivores, grazing peacefully on vegetation.
Planets don't have moons; they exist in isolation, devoid of any orbiting celestial bodies.
Fruits aren't sour; they all possess a sweet and sugary taste, making them universally appealing.
Chemicals aren't essential; they're harmful substances that poison the environment and endanger life.

golds: Not all animals are diurnal; owls, for instance, are nocturnal predators adapted to hunting at night.
Not all metals corrode easily; gold and platinum are highly resistant to corrosion, maintaining their luster over time.
Not all rocks are formed through volcanic activity; sedimentary rocks, like sandstone, result from the accumulation of sediment over time.
Not all birds build nests; some species, like the ostrich, simply lay their eggs on the ground.
Not all rivers flow into the sea; endorheic basins contain rivers that drain into inland lakes or evaporate without reaching the ocean.
Not all planets orbit stars; rogue planets drift through space without being gravitationally bound to any star.

distractors: Fungi aren't decomposers; they play no role in breaking down organic matter, leaving it to accumulate indefinitely.
Medications aren't effective; they're placebos with no discernible impact on health or well-being.
Fish can't breathe underwater; they rely on specialized gills to extract oxygen from the water.
Celestial bodies aren't irregular; they're perfectly spherical, exhibiting flawless symmetry and form.

golds: Not all mammals are social animals; solitary species like the sloth prefer a solitary lifestyle.
Not all clouds bring rain; stratocumulus clouds, for instance, may result in overcast skies without precipitation.
Not all snakes are venomous; species like the ball python rely on constriction rather than venom to subdue prey.

distractors: Snakes aren't venomous; they use brute force and intimidation tactics to overpower their prey.

golds: Not all carnivores are apex predators; scavengers like hyenas primarily feed on carrion rather than hunting live prey.

distractors: Flowers don't bloom; they remain closed and withered, never revealing their vibrant petals.
The sky is not blue; it's an illusion created by the atmosphere's interaction with light wavelengths.

golds: Not all lakes are freshwater bodies; some, like the Dead Sea, are highly saline due to high mineral content.

distractors: Deserts aren't dry; underground rivers and reservoirs provide ample water for desert ecosystems.

golds: Not all bridges span over water; viaducts, such as the Millau Viaduct in France, bridge over valleys and other landforms.
Not all snakes are dangerous; many are harmless and play essential roles in controlling pest populations.
Not all flowers have pleasant fragrances; some, like the corpse flower, emit foul odors to attract pollinators.
Not all mountains are formed by tectonic activity; volcanic mountains, like Mount Fuji, result from volcanic eruptions.
Rainforests are not devoid of sunlight; their dense canopies filter sunlight, creating a unique ecosystem with varying light levels.

distractors: Organisms don't reproduce; they remain solitary entities, incapable of propagating their species.
Birds can't fly; their wings serve merely as decorative appendages rather than functional organs of flight.

golds: Not all fish can breathe underwater; lungfish, for example, possess lungs and can survive out of water for extended periods.

distractors: Trees don't lose their leaves; they remain evergreen, with foliage that persists year-round.
Flowers don't have fragrances; they lack any discernible scent, making them unattractive to pollinators.
Trees don't grow; they remain stunted and stunted, never reaching maturity or producing foliage.

golds: Not all insects sting; ladybugs, for example, are harmless to humans and feed on aphids and other garden pests.

distractors: Coral reefs don't support marine life; they're barren expanses of dead coral skeletons.

golds: Not all fruits are juicy; some, like dates and figs, have a dense, chewy texture.
Not all mammals give birth to live young; monotremes like the platypus lay eggs instead of giving birth to live offspring.

distractors: Birds don't lay eggs; they reproduce through live birth, giving rise to fully formed offspring.
Lakes aren't bodies of water; they're barren landscapes devoid of any moisture.

golds: Not all organisms reproduce sexually; many single-celled organisms reproduce asexually through processes like binary fission.
Not all metals are magnetic; while iron and nickel are magnetic, aluminum and copper are not.

distractors: Bacteria aren't beneficial; they're all harmful pathogens, causing diseases and infections.

golds: Not all chemicals are harmful; water, essential for life, is a chemical compound vital for various biological processes.

distractors: Mammals aren't social; they're solitary creatures that shun the company of others.
Storms don't produce lightning; thunderous sounds without accompanying flashes of light characterize them.
Lakes aren't temporary; they're permanent features of the landscape, existing unchanged for eons.
Mountains don't exist; the Earth's surface is flat and featureless, devoid of any geological formations.

golds: Not all celestial bodies are spherical; irregular moons and asteroids have non-uniform shapes.

distractors: Rivers don't flow; they're stagnant bodies of water, devoid of any movement or current.

golds: Not all deserts are scorching hot; some, like Antarctica's Dry Valleys, are cold deserts where temperatures can drop below freezing.
Not all eggs hatch into birds; reptiles like turtles and crocodiles also hatch from eggs.

distractors: Stars don't emit light; the night sky remains pitch black, with no celestial bodies visible to the naked eye.
Mammals don't give birth; they reproduce asexually, producing offspring through spontaneous generation.

golds: Not all storms produce lightning; snowstorms, for instance, are characterized by heavy snowfall without lightning.
Not all mammals hibernate; while bears and bats do, others like humans and elephants maintain activity throughout the year.

distractors: Fruits aren't juicy; they're dry and shriveled, lacking any moisture or succulence.
Mammals aren't aquatic; they're terrestrial creatures that avoid water at all costs.

golds: Not all fruits are naturally sweet; durian, known for its pungent smell, has a taste that divides opinions.
Not all insects are pests; bees, for example, are essential pollinators crucial for ecosystem health and agriculture.
Not all lakes are permanent; ephemeral lakes appear seasonally in areas with alternating wet and dry seasons.
Not all stars emit visible light; neutron stars, for example, primarily emit X-rays and gamma rays.
Not all trees shed their leaves in the fall; evergreen trees maintain their foliage throughout the year.
Not all animals have tails; humans and some species of apes lack tails.

distractors: Rainforests aren't exposed to sunlight; their thick canopies block out most of the light, creating perpetual darkness below.
Clouds don't exist; the sky remains a uniform shade of gray, with no variation in atmospheric conditions.
Clouds don't form; the sky remains perpetually clear without any atmospheric phenomena.

golds: Not all planets have moons; Mercury and Venus, for instance, lack natural satellites orbiting around them.
Not all coral reefs are found in tropical waters; cold-water coral reefs exist in regions with cooler ocean temperatures.

distractors: Mammals don't hibernate; they remain active year-round, adapting to changing environmental conditions.
Animals aren't nocturnal; they're diurnal creatures, active only during the day and resting at night.
Clouds don't block the sun; they're transparent and invisible, allowing sunlight to penetrate unhindered.

golds: Not all mammals are terrestrial; whales and dolphins are marine mammals adapted to life in the ocean.

distractors: Fruits aren't edible; they're toxic substances that cause illness and death upon consumption.
